title: Reinterpreting ICT in Virtual Learning Environments: Blended Methodology-Based Mathematics Education Design for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, online learning experience, and fundamental statistical/mathematical analysis skills
context.additional_context: Project-centered course where pre-service teachers reinterpret ICT utilization methods in LMS-based mathematics education design. Emphasizes data-driven decision-making for improving mathematics pedagogy

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the sociocultural impacts of ICT tools (techno-culture, cybercitizenship) in virtual environments through mathematical modeling.

Learners can statistically analyze online interaction data (e.g., LMS logs, discussion forum activities) to generate at least three critical reflection questions (e.g., data reliability, bias, educational effectiveness), and write a 500-character report evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of ICT utilization strategies based on these questions.
Learners can present a project deliverable proposing ICT integration strategies for building a sustainable learning ecosystem by applying mathematical problem-solving approaches.

resources: Digital Content Samples for Mathematics Education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
